AWD Sheath Blight Study Notes

A H Sparks, N P Castilla and M Noel

2018-11-22

Source: vignettes/AWD_Sheath_Blight_Study_Notes.Rmd
AWD_Sheath_Blight_Study_Notes.Rmd

Although this study examines the same effect of alternate wetting and drying (AWD) on rice sheath blight, causal agent Rhizoctonia solani, there are differences between the 2015 and 2016 seasons that make them two separate experiments that cannot be analysed as one. These changes are a result of the findings in 2015 and were made in an effort to improve the experiment.

The differences are:

  • plot sizes are larger in 2016 than 2015,

  • the inoculation amounts and timing differ with 2016 having more applied to the sampling area at a later date after transplanting, and

  • nitrogen rates were changed in 2016.

See the following lists for complete details.

Schedule

IRRI Dry Season (2)

  • 2015 (December 2014 – April 2015)

  • 2016 (January 2016 - May 2016)

Methodology

Experimental Design: Split-plot

  • Main plot : Water management (2)

    • W1 – Alternate Wetting and Drying (AWD)

    • W2 – Puddled (Farmers’ Practice)

  • Sub-plot : Nitrogen management (5)

    • 2015

      • N0 – 0 kg/ha

      • N1 – 100 kg/ha

      • N2 – 120 kg/ha

    • 2016

      • N3 – 60 kg/ha

      • N4 - 180 kg/ha

Plot layout

  • Replication: Four (4)

  • Plot Sizes (2015)

    • Main plot size: 12m x 12m (144 sq m)

    • Sub-plot size: 5m x 5m (25 sq m)

    • Replication size: 12m x 24m (288 sq m)

    • Buffer: 1m per sub plot

    • Experiment size: 1,152 sq m

  • Plot Sizes (2016)

    • Main plot size

    • Block 2007: 21m x 20.5m (412.5 sq m)

    • Block 2008: 20.25m x 21.6m (437.4 sq m)

    • Sub-plot size

    • Block 2007: 21m x 10.25m (215.25 sq m)

    • Block 2008: 20.25m x 10.8m (218.7 sq m)

    • Replication size:

    • Block 2007: 42m x 20.5m (861 sq m)

    • Block 2008: 40.5m x 21.6m (874.8 sq m)

    • Buffer: 0.5m per sub plot

    • Experiment size: 3471.6 sq m

Inoculation methods

  • Inoculation methods (2015)

    • 20 bottles (1 bottle = 151g) of inoculum were spread over each plot (4m x 11m)

  • Inoculation methods (2016)

    • 10 bottles (1 bottle = 151g) of inoculum were spread over one sampling area (1m x 1m) in each plot

Disease Rating Scale

Disease was rated using an ordinal scale for field evaluation of sheath blight (S Savary & N Castilla).

  • Rating Scale - Severity (%)

    • 0 - 0,

    • 1 - 1%,

    • 2 - 5%,

    • 3 - 15%,

    • 4 - 50%,

    • 5 - >50%
